diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: WrittenWork. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: author - Example triple: (1634: The Baltic War | author | David Weber)
Predicate: isbnNumber - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | isbnNumber | "978-1-4165-4253-7")
Predicate: followedBy - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | followedBy | Ring of Fire II)
Predicate: language - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | language | English language)
Predicate: mediaType - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | mediaType | "Print")
Predicate: numberOfPages - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | numberOfPages | "448")
Predicate: precededBy - Example triple: (1634: The Bavarian Crisis | precededBy | "DeMarce short stories in the The Grantville Gazettes")
Predicate: country - Example triple: (1634: The Ram Rebellion | country | United States)
Predicate: almaMater - Example triple: (A.T. Charlie Johnson | almaMater | Harvard University)
Predicate: doctoralAdvisor - Example triple: (A.T. Charlie Johnson | doctoralAdvisor | Michael Tinkham)
Predicate: nationality - Example triple: (A.T. Charlie Johnson | nationality | United States)
Predicate: residence - Example triple: (A.T. Charlie Johnson | residence | United States)
Predicate: codenCode - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | codenCode | "ATISET")
Predicate: issnNumber - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | issnNumber | "1046-8188")
Predicate: LCCN_number - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | LCCN_number | 89646863)
Predicate: abbreviation - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | abbreviation | "ACM Trans. Inf. Syst.")
Predicate: academicDiscipline - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | academicDiscipline | Computer science)
Predicate: publisher - Example triple: (ACM Transactions on Information Systems | publisher | Association for Computing Machinery)
Predicate: firstPublicationYear - Example triple: (AIDS (journal) | firstPublicationYear | 1987)
Predicate: editor - Example triple: (AIP Advances | editor | "Vincent H. Crespi, Bernard S. Gerstman, A.T. Charlie Johnson,  Masaaki Tanaka, Enge G. Wang")
Predicate: impactFactor - Example triple: (AIP Advances | impactFactor | "1.524")
Predicate: oclcNumber - Example triple: (A Fortress of Grey Ice | oclcNumber | 51969173)
Predicate: libraryofCongressClassification - Example triple: (A Glastonbury Romance | libraryofCongressClassification | "PR6031.O867")
Predicate: genre - Example triple: (Alcatraz Versus the Evil Librarians | genre | Fantasy literature)
Predicate: literaryGenre - Example triple: (Alcatraz Versus the Evil Librarians | literaryGenre | Fantasy literature)
Predicate: eissnNumber - Example triple: (American Journal of Mathematics | eissnNumber | 1080)
Predicate: frequency - Example triple: (American Journal of Mathematics | frequency | "Bimonthly")
Predicate: headquarter - Example triple: (Association for Computing Machinery | headquarter | New York City)
Predicate: leader - Example triple: (Association for Computing Machinery | leader | Alexander L. Wolf)
Predicate: birthPlace - Example triple: (Brandon Sanderson | birthPlace | Lincoln, Nebraska)
Predicate: affiliation - Example triple: (Cornell University | affiliation | Association of American Universities)
Predicate: city - Example triple: (Cornell University | city | Ithaca, New York)
Predicate: president - Example triple: (Cornell University | president | Elizabeth Garrett)
Predicate: state - Example triple: (Cornell University | state | New York)
Predicate: spokenIn - Example triple: (English language | spokenIn | Great Britain)
Predicate: influencedBy - Example triple: (Eric Flint | influencedBy | Robert A. Heinlein)
Predicate: family - Example triple: (HIV | family | Orthoretrovirinae)
Predicate: ethnicGroup - Example triple: (Ireland | ethnicGroup | White people)
Predicate: largestCity - Example triple: (Ireland | largestCity | Dublin)
Predicate: location - Example triple: (Ireland | location | Europe)
Predicate: deathPlace - Example triple: (John Cowper Powys | deathPlace | Blaenau Ffestiniog)
Predicate: notableWork - Example triple: (John Cowper Powys | notableWork | Owen Glendower (novel))
Predicate: parentCompany - Example triple: (Johns Hopkins University Press | parentCompany | Johns Hopkins University)
Predicate: regionServed - Example triple: (Polish Academy of Sciences | regionServed | Poland)
Predicate: founder - Example triple: (SAGE Publications | founder | Sara Miller McCune)
Predicate: capital - Example triple: (United Kingdom | capital | London)
Predicate: demonym - Example triple: (United Kingdom | demonym | British people)
Predicate: leaderTitle - Example triple: (United States | leaderTitle | President of the United States)
Predicate: nickname - Example triple: (Cornell University | nickname | Cornell Big Red)
Predicate: genus - Example triple: (HIV | genus | Lentivirus)
Predicate: releaseDate - Example triple: (The Fellowship of the Ring | releaseDate | 1954-07-29)
Predicate: birthDate - Example triple: (J. R. R. Tolkien | birthDate | 1892-01-03)
